synsets.definition: A state of emotional blockage where feelings cannot flow through one's being, like wood that has lost its natural channels; complete disconnection from inner emotional currents
synsets.cultural_note: Traditional Chinese concept linking emotional flow to natural elements, where blocked qi creates emotional numbness

synsets.definition: A condition where the heart becomes so saturated with unexpressed emotion that it loses all sensitivity, like wood too waterlogged to burn or respond
synsets.cultural_note: Reflects Japanese understanding of emotional oversaturation leading paradoxically to numbness

synsets.definition: The freezing of one's emotional core due to accumulated han, resulting in inability to access or express any feelings
synsets.cultural_note: Korean concept where collective grief becomes so intense it creates emotional paralysis

synsets.definition: Spiritual blindness to one's own emotional states, considered a form of avidya (ignorance) that prevents self-knowledge and dharmic living
synsets.cultural_note: Sanskrit concept linking emotional awareness to spiritual enlightenment and dharmic duty

synsets.definition: The hardening of the inner self until emotions cannot penetrate or be felt, often from excessive focus on external aṟam while neglecting inner life
synsets.cultural_note: Tamil concept of emotional petrification from imbalanced virtue practice

synsets.definition: A state where kreng jai has become so extreme that one's own emotional needs and awareness completely disappear, leaving only consideration for others
synsets.cultural_note: Thai concept of self-emotional death through excessive other-consideration

synsets.definition: Loss of emotional sensitivity through excessive focus on gotong royong, where individual feelings become completely submerged in collective harmony
synsets.cultural_note: Javanese concept of emotional blindness through over-identification with community

synsets.definition: A heart that has lost its ability to perceive its own emotional states, considered a spiritual disease that prevents true sabr and wisdom
synsets.cultural_note: Islamic concept linking emotional awareness to spiritual health and patience

synsets.definition: A heart so defended by taarof and social barriers that even the owner cannot access their true feelings beneath the protective layers
synsets.cultural_note: Persian concept of emotional inaccessibility through excessive social courtesy

synsets.definition: A heart closed to its own emotional experience, preventing the self-knowledge necessary for meaningful tikkun olam
synsets.cultural_note: Hebrew concept linking emotional self-awareness to ability to repair the world

synsets.definition: A heart that has lost its light of self-understanding, unable to recognize its own emotional states and therefore unable to truly connect in Ubuntu
synsets.cultural_note: East African concept where emotional self-blindness prevents authentic human connection

synsets.definition: A heart that has died to its own emotional experience while still beating, often from disconnection from ancestral wisdom and community
synsets.cultural_note: Yoruba concept of emotional death while physically alive, linked to spiritual disconnection

synsets.definition: A state where one's emotional center has become so disconnected that feelings cannot be perceived, breaking the sacred circle of mitakuye oyasin
synsets.cultural_note: Lakota concept of emotional disconnection that breaks relationship with all beings

synsets.definition: When the inner spirit becomes blocked from feeling its own emotional movements, making dadirri impossible because one cannot listen to their own heart
synsets.cultural_note: Aboriginal Australian concept of spiritual blockage preventing inner listening

synsets.definition: A heart that has dried up from within, unable to feel even saudade, completely disconnected from its own emotional landscape
synsets.cultural_note: Brazilian concept of complete emotional drought, worse than sadness because it's absence of all feeling

synsets.definition: Blindness to one's own emotional states that disrupts social harmony because authentic connection requires emotional self-knowledge
synsets.cultural_note: Chinese concept emphasizing how personal emotional blindness affects social relationships

synsets.definition: Complete severance from one's own emotional experience, making authentic participation in wa impossible because one brings no genuine feeling
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese concept of emotional amputation that prevents true harmony

synsets.definition: An emotional void where jeong should flow, creating inability to give or receive affection due to complete emotional numbness
synsets.cultural_note: Korean concept of emotional emptiness preventing the flow of caring affection

synsets.definition: Delusion about one's own emotional attachments and states, a form of maya that prevents clear self-perception and spiritual progress
synsets.cultural_note: Sanskrit concept of emotional self-delusion as obstacle to enlightenment

synsets.definition: Loss of emotional generosity including toward oneself; inability to feel or extend nam jai because one's emotional well has dried up
synsets.cultural_note: Thai concept of losing emotional generosity through disconnection from feeling

synsets.definition: A conscience and emotional awareness that has died, preventing the inner perception necessary for true hikmah and spiritual wisdom
synsets.cultural_note: Arabic concept linking emotional awareness to conscience and divine wisdom

synsets.definition: A heart that has died to its own emotional experience, breaking the connection needed for true community participation and Ubuntu
synsets.cultural_note: Igbo concept of emotional death that prevents authentic community engagement

synsets.definition: A state where one's emotions have become non-existent to oneself, breaking the sacred balance and connection to all relations
synsets.cultural_note: Navajo concept of emotional non-existence disrupting sacred balance and relationships

synsets.definition: The death of heart-knowing while the physical heart continues; inability to feel one's emotional connection to Pachamama and community
synsets.cultural_note: Quechua Andean concept of heart-death disconnecting from earth and community feeling

synsets.definition: A heart that sleeps to its own emotional reality, preventing the deep respeto that comes from understanding one's own emotional truth
synsets.cultural_note: Mexican concept where emotional self-ignorance prevents authentic respect and relationship
